gov.usgs.anss.util

Class RTSCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.util.RTSCommand

  • public class RTSCommand
extends java.lang.Object
    RTSCommand.java contains the knowlege of how to build command buffers for the RTS SocketServer. There is a long list of static variables starting with USGS_CMD which are the command integers understood by the RTS. There is a separate method for each command which returns a raw byte buffer with the command propery encoded from arguments to the method. Created on January 14, 2004, 10:05 AM

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CONSOLE
      USGS port type for the conole port role
      static int DATA
      Usgs port type for the data port using Gomberg packets
      static int GPS
      Usgs port type for a GPS port (binary transfer blocked about 256 bytes)
      static int MSHEAR
      Usgs port type for a MShear based data port - checks of acks
      static int RTS
      RTS usgs port type code for an RTS - status/command port

      • reset

        public byte[] reset(java.lang.String ipadr)
        Encode the command buffer for a RTS reset.
        Parameters:
        ipadr - The IP address as a nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn of an RTS to be reset.
        Returns:
        A raw byte buffer with the bytes for a reset.

      • setOverride

        public byte[] setOverride(java.lang.String ipadr,
                          short rate)
        encode the RTS command buffer for a Set Maximum Override of Baud Rate.
        Parameters:
        ipadr - The IP address as a nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn of an RTS to be sent the command
        rate - The new baud rate limit.
        Returns:
        A raw byte buffer with the bytes for a loop test command.

      • setUseBackupIP

        public byte[] setUseBackupIP(java.lang.String ipadr,
                             boolean flag)
        encode the RTS command buffer for a Set Maximum Override of Baud Rate.
        Parameters:
        ipadr - The IP address as a nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn of an RTS to be sent the command
        flag - if true, use Backup IP addressing on VSAT back hauls.
        Returns:
        A raw byte buffer with the bytes for a loop test command.

      • setUsgsType

        public byte[] setUsgsType(java.lang.String ipadr,
                          int serial,
                          int type,
                          java.lang.String ip,
                          java.lang.String altip,
                          int port,
                          boolean client)
        encode the RTS command buffer for a Configure USGS port.
        Parameters:
        ipadr - The IP address as a nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn of an RTS to be sent the command
        serial - The target serial port on RTS (0 to 3) for ports 1 to 4.
        type - The type of port. See enum in tcpstation table for encoding.
        ip - The IP address to program this port to contact if it is a client
        altip - The alternate IP address to program this port to contact if it is a client
        port - The port number the RTS is to contact if this serial port will be a client
        client - Boolean indicating whether the RTS serial port is a client (originates sockets).
        Returns:
        A raw byte buffer with the bytes for a configure USGS port command.

      • setRtsMode

        public byte[] setRtsMode(java.lang.String ipadr,
                         boolean mode)
        encode the RTS command buffer for a set Mode (whether RTS connects as client)
        Parameters:
        ipadr - The IP address as a nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn of an RTS to be sent the command
        mode - boolean - turn on the RTS port to connect to golden if true
        Returns:
        A raw byte buffer with the bytes for a loop test command.
